page.title: 18MOUNT MASKALL 2 BOREHAM
page.content: A fine brick barn, with wide bands of mortar between the bricks, was built in 1550. The barn stands today a tribute to the builders.The house was given a Georgian facade in 1746,Mount Maskall was at that time part of the New Hall estate.The building is well proportioned. there is a fine oak beam above the fireplace in the hall. On the walls of the hall is a hanging showing the Arthur families Coat of Arms,and 2 banners that were carried by the trumpeters when the owner was the High Sheriff of Essex in 1971. The owner believes that Mount may be a derivation of the word mott and that the original house may have been built on a man made mound surrounded by a moat.Looking at the site this would seem quite likely the pond adjacent to the house could be the remains of the moat.Some fine water fowl live there.
